duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage permitting activities throughout the site development process for a pipeline of wind, transmission, solar, storage and green fuels projects including permit applications, site control, layout planning, and review of environmental studies.
Lead and advise project managers, company development directors, and others regarding the environmental permitting of projects from planning phases through implementation.
Supervise the work of project environmental consultants, managing project schedules and budgets, and ensuring quality of documents.
Assist with the preparation of NEPA (National Environmental Policy Act) and state environmental documents, including EISs, EAs, and other federal, state, and local environmental permits as needed.
Peer-review drafts of permit applications, studies, scopes of work, and reports for environmental permitting and studies.
Respond to internal environmental-related inquiries in support of Power Purchase Agreement bids, project financing, and third-party due diligence.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree; a master’s degree a plus
